content:
Posted: December 19, 2015
												Star Wars Battlefront 2 is one of the best games out there. Even better that the first one. It adds up more vehicles, classes and you can also play as a Hero (Jedi, Sith, Bounty Hunter etc.)! The graphics are amazing considering the time that the game came out. I love this game so much, I still have and play the PS2, XBOX and PSP versions of the game.Having a huge variety of maps, the fun never ends, you can test your skills in instant action with four game modes (conques, ctf, heroes vs villians and assault),then you can conquer the galaxy in Galactic Conquest mode choosing from four (4) factions (Rebels vs Empire and CIS vs Republic). The maps are amazing, really big, it's a war game afterall. You also have the ability to play space battles, something that the first game lacked (and the newest one...), your objective is to destroy the enemy capital ship!But no, that's not all. Download mods and or maps (prefered) in which you play space to ground on the maps the game already has or new maps that fans made!People still play the game online so it's not dead! This is hands down one of the best, if not the best Star Wars game!There are some glitches but not game breaking. Some characters are over-powered but they can be defeated if you know how to play well of course! The developers did a great job, but there are some stuff they could have added such as space to ground battles and the ability to escape enemy capital ships with an escape pod just like Elite Squadron.Other than that Star Wars Battlefront 2 is an amazing game and you should have it in your game library!9/10

content:
Posted: May 21, 2014
												Star Wars: Battlefront II...A classic...but a classic that seems unfinished and deserving of the rating it recieved on many other review sites such as IGN, Gamespot, Gamespy, and Joystiq. The game while massively fun has a lot of problems.Let's start with the gameplay. The gameplay is anything but bad. It is fun. A heck of a lot of fun. There are two teams who are pitted against each other in a classic conquest style FPS game format. The teams must either eliminate all the other teams reinforcements, or capture all the control points. It is very fast paced and chaotic. Much more chaotic than the first game. This time you can have up to 64 bots in a match unlike the previous game, making for an exhilarating experience. Now we get to the campaign. I guess it isn't bad but it isn't anything to be overjoyed about. Basically the campaign has you playing as the 501st Legion throughout the first 6 episodes of Star Wars. The thing is though is the maps and general objectives are the same as the multiplayer. Doesn't sound like too much fun does it. Now tack on some stupid (no not stupid, just ♥♥♥♥♥♥♥♥) bots. Seriously, they act ♥♥♥♥♥♥♥♥. You basically will end up doing all the work. I had 300 points during one round while the best bot on my team had only 16 STINKING POINTS! What the heck! Now that is just dumb. I am being nice by not mentioning the enemy team. Your probably wondering by now why I said "I guess it isn't bad" at the beginning of this paragraph. The reason I said that is because I couldn't think of a better way to do it. That was probably the best campaign they could pull off in terms of story and gameplay. Ok, time to talk about the graphics. They are terrible. Just terrible. I maxed the game out including anti-aliasing and it looked like junk. I felt like I was playing on a PS2. Now I know that this game is old and a "sort of" port from the console versions, but still. You think they could've added some more graphical polish for the PC version. The sound is clear, and crisp. The music and voice-over work feels believable and very Star Wars like. There was an issue with the "Stereo Mix" and microphone that kept causing the game to crash but thankfully I fixed it. The Star Wars music is a nice touch too.The game will last and you will get many hours out of it. The only concern is that Gamespy is shutting down at the end of May so you will have to use a third party application or addon, to play online (not the bots pleaaasssseee!)Overall Rating: 6/10Presentation: 7/10Story: 5/10Gameplay: 7/10Graphics: 5/10Sound: 8/10Lasting Appeal: 7/10Overall Rating: 6/10

Stereo mix may be disabled on your PC, and that might be the reason as to why you can't access the game.To re-enable Stereo mix:-Go to Control Panel.-Click on Hardware and Sound.-Click on the sound tab.-Go to Recording.-Right click on the blank space, and click on "Show Disabled Devices".From there, you should be able to view and reenable Stereo Mix, allowing you to play Battlefront 2.Thanks again to Senor Mexicano.Also, Droidekas are awful.

content:
Posted: December 19, 2015
												Star Wars Battlefront 2 is one of the best games out there. Even better that the first one. It adds up more vehicles, classes and you can also play as a Hero (Jedi, Sith, Bounty Hunter etc.)! The graphics are amazing considering the time that the game came out. I love this game so much, I still have and play the PS2, XBOX and PSP versions of the game.Having a huge variety of maps, the fun never ends, you can test your skills in instant action with four game modes (conques, ctf, heroes vs villians and assault),then you can conquer the galaxy in Galactic Conquest mode choosing from four (4) factions (Rebels vs Empire and CIS vs Republic). The maps are amazing, really big, it's a war game afterall. You also have the ability to play space battles, something that the first game lacked (and the newest one...), your objective is to destroy the enemy capital ship!But no, that's not all. Download mods and or maps (prefered) in which you play space to ground on the maps the game already has or new maps that fans made!People still play the game online so it's not dead! This is hands down one of the best, if not the best Star Wars game!There are some glitches but not game breaking. Some characters are over-powered but they can be defeated if you know how to play well of course! The developers did a great job, but there are some stuff they could have added such as space to ground battles and the ability to escape enemy capital ships with an escape pod just like Elite Squadron.Other than that Star Wars Battlefront 2 is an amazing game and you should have it in your game library!9/10

Posted: December 3, 2015
												''Based on a true story.''• I was only nine years old.• I loved Battlefront 2 so much, I had it for the original PS2.• I pray to LucasArts, every night before bed, thanking them for the games I have been given.• ''LucasArts, is love'' I say, ''LucasArts, is life.''• My dad hears me and calls me a console peasant.• I knew he was just jealous of my devotion for Battlefront 2.• I called him a PC master faget.• He slaps me and tells me to play on the PC.• I'm crying now and my face hurts.• I install the Steam client and it's really cold.• A warmth is moving towards me.• I feel something touch me.• It's Gaben.• I am so happy.• He whispers in my ear, ''-75% STAR WARS Battlefront II  ''• He grabs my wallet with his powerful gaming hands and puts me on my hands and knees.• I'm ready.• I agreed with the Steam terms and conditions.• He penetrates my wallet hole.• It hurt so much, but I do it for -75% Star Wars.• I can feel my wallet emptying as my eyes start to water.• I purchased the Star Wars Complete Pack.• I want to please Gaben.• He roars a mighty roar as he fills my inventory with his coupons.• My dad walks in.• Gaben looks him straight in the eyes and says, ''It was worth the weight.''• Gaben leaves through my window.• Gaben is love, Gaben is life.'And that is how I became a PC gamer.'

content:
Posted: December 29, 2015
												This game.....I love this game to death. I've played countless hours on the ps2 version of this game, and now that i've had it for a while on pc...Its still as great as it used to be! This is THE star wars game (If you're looking for the infantry viewpoint) to play. Graphics and animation are par for the course (if not better) from the ps2 era of games. The sound design is wonderful, blasters and lightsabers sound the way they should. Though, the original cast didn't make a return to voice the hero/villians (Mark Hammil, Harrison Ford etc). The story is wonderful, the telling of the republics fall to the empire and retelling the story from episode 3 and the story arc ends at the battle of hoth. There is also galactic conquest, a board game type play style where the objective is to capture planets and establish a hold over the galaxy. Then comes the meat of this games replayable nature, instant action. This is the "free play" mode of the game, being able to play on every planet, with every game mode (Conquest, 2 and 1 flag ctf, hunt, and my favorite hero assault). The space battles, abeit limited are very good and no star wars game since has made casual dogfighting as much fun as this. All in all, this game is a must buy if you are a star wars fan (like myself :3) Despite the missing multiplayer component, it is still great fun to play. This is a great game.

content:
Posted: May 8, 2013
												If you're reading this, I have one question to ask you.Why don't you have this game?Seriously, this game is just simply worth owning because its so much fun. It features a great offline mode, a varity of options and a very chaotic multiplayer. Not only that, but this game has a great modding community. You can see things from maps and units to entire game patches. However, the game does have some major compatibility issues with Windows Vista and up. First off, the main menu is permanently stuck at a fixed resolution(you can change it from the launch options, but the entire menu will become messed up), however 1980 X 1080 is supported when in game. Second off, there's an audio bug that halts the audio for a few seconds, then continues on. That can be fixed via launch options and by enabling stereo mix in your sound settings. Now the next big thing I havn't gotten, but other have been having crashing problems. From what I heard, you can prevent it from happening if you have something plugged into your mic jack (weird solution, I know). Aside from these issues, the game shines great and is amazing fun. If you like large open battles, epic space battles with starships, and intense close quaters combat, this game is for you.

content:
Posted: December 28, 2013
												This game came out during a really great time for Star Wars games.  It was surrounded by Jedi Outcast, Jedi Academy, Battlefront 1, Empire at War, Revenge of the Sith video game, The Sith Lords (KotOR2), Republic Commando, Star Wars Galaxies Total Experience, Clone Campaigns, etc.  And unfortunately, after 2006 there were very little Star Wars games that were any good.  So this game, to me, is considered one of the great ones of the pinacle of Star Wars gaming.The classes are well balanced.  The special troops have very different styles of play, but are not op.  The Clone Commander might have a machien gun with unlimited bullets, but it has no grenades, and is good only for close up troop destruction.  The droideka is pretty awesome, but it has a completely different playstyle as well.You have to get quite a bit of shots off the kill someone.  Even vehicles cannot one shot you.  The only one shots in the game are lightsabers and the sniper rifle head shots.  As it gets harder it definitely does get harder.  Space combat takes a bit fo a learning curve at first, but in one or two space combats you will be able to learn the gist of it.  I would say the only major downfall is the AI.  They can literally hurt your game.  In one mission (the mission I always have trouble with) you have to defend the Jedi library from being destroyed by the Jedi (they don't want the Empire to get the knowledge within it).  With a close up shotgun to the head, you can kill them in two shots.  Otherwise, otherwise they take 2-3 shots to take down.  The AI would face off against a Jedi, shoot it once, and then run out of the room to some other place.  Seriously, the AI will force me to quit in anger.  Even the opposing AI is somewhat stupid.  But the online play fixes that.So out of all the game, the only detracting qualities are the sometimes pathetic AI and the (expected) learning curve for the space combat.  Otherwise, this game is a mighty good farewell to a great generation of Star Wars gamers and games in general.

content:
Posted: July 17, 2014
												I've played this game from childhood for at least 7 years, on the PS2 and now on PC. It never ceases to entertain me, and is the best game in the group of Star Wars games in my opinion. It's very unfortunate the Gamespy will be shutting its doors, and that Multiplayer may shut down as well, but singleplayer is still an exciting experience. You can set major battles across many maps, on land and on space. You can imagine your war as you want, and bring in some of your favorite characters from the story, and do campaign to go into the story and even see things not in the movies or comics. What I love most about this game would have to be Galactic Conquest. content:
Posted: May 21, 2014
												Star Wars: Battlefront II...A classic...but a classic that seems unfinished and deserving of the rating it recieved on many other review sites such as IGN, Gamespot, Gamespy, and Joystiq. The game while massively fun has a lot of problems.Let's start with the gameplay. The gameplay is anything but bad. It is fun. A heck of a lot of fun. There are two teams who are pitted against each other in a classic conquest style FPS game format. The teams must either eliminate all the other teams reinforcements, or capture all the control points. It is very fast paced and chaotic. Much more chaotic than the first game. This time you can have up to 64 bots in a match unlike the previous game, making for an exhilarating experience. Now we get to the campaign. I guess it isn't bad but it isn't anything to be overjoyed about. Basically the campaign has you playing as the 501st Legion throughout the first 6 episodes of Star Wars. The thing is though is the maps and general objectives are the same as the multiplayer. Doesn't sound like too much fun does it. Now tack on some stupid (no not stupid, just ♥♥♥♥♥♥♥♥) bots. Seriously, they act ♥♥♥♥♥♥♥♥. You basically will end up doing all the work. I had 300 points during one round while the best bot on my team had only 16 STINKING POINTS! What the heck! Now that is just dumb. I am being nice by not mentioning the enemy team. Your probably wondering by now why I said "I guess it isn't bad" at the beginning of this paragraph. The reason I said that is because I couldn't think of a better way to do it. That was probably the best campaign they could pull off in terms of story and gameplay. Ok, time to talk about the graphics. They are terrible. Just terrible. I maxed the game out including anti-aliasing and it looked like junk. I felt like I was playing on a PS2. Now I know that this game is old and a "sort of" port from the console versions, but still. You think they could've added some more graphical polish for the PC version. The sound is clear, and crisp. The music and voice-over work feels believable and very Star Wars like. There was an issue with the "Stereo Mix" and microphone that kept causing the game to crash but thankfully I fixed it. The Star Wars music is a nice touch too.The game will last and you will get many hours out of it. The only concern is that Gamespy is shutting down at the end of May so you will have to use a third party application or addon, to play online (not the bots pleaaasssseee!)Overall Rating: 6/10Presentation: 7/10Story: 5/10Gameplay: 7/10Graphics: 5/10Sound: 8/10Lasting Appeal: 7/10Overall Rating: 6/10

content:
Posted: January 26
												After the massive failure that was Battlefront. Star Wars Battlefront II is still the go to game after all these many years. I still find myself enjoying this game and all it's content, that is sadly lacking from the EA released installment. But enough about that mess. We're here to talk about this gem and all it's glory.   Available to you are  a couple of  game modes like Galactic Conquest (my personal favorite) where you are able to build/control fleets that you can navigate on a galactic map against the AI. There are startegic elements present in this game mode like building a fleet over an occupied space to keep the enemy from taking it over without a fight. Usually resulting in a fun space battle. Building said fleets costs money however, which is  usually earned after each turn if you have control of a planet(s) and I believe by succesfully winning a skirmish. Also available to purchase are bonuses that can help you in your campaign - like extra troops, regenerating health, auto-turrets that protect your command posts and enhanced weapon damage. These bonuses are however one time use and only one active bonus is available per skirmish. So you'll have to purchase a new bonus before each skirmish.   The other mode is the Rise of the Empire Campaign where you play as the 501st Legion (Vaders Fist). Mainly taking place during the start of the Clone Wars, beginning with the battle of Geonosis, all the way to the battle at Echo Base on planet Hoth. This game mode mainly has you completing objectives to progress the storyline, such as recovering an item from the enemy, Defending a post from being overrun by the enemy or destroying a target. I wasn't too much of a fan of this game mode, not to say this mode isn't fun, but I would rather just play Galactic Conquest instead. And then there is Instant Action, where you can instantly jump into matches that you set up before hand. But all that pales in comparison to the great multiplayer that once was. If you were lucky enough to have been able to play this game back when the online was alive and kicking, then you got to witness one of the funnest online games to ever grace this earth.Sadly, the online is no more and the only way to play this beauty is to download some software like Hamachi to play with other people. Even then, there isn't much to hope for since you're not likely to find enough people to fill up the lobby, which is necessary for that true experience. It's just not the same otherwise, as bots don't make for fun matches. I would still recommend people to pick this game up, even today, as it is still one of the funnest games out there and it's certainly much better than Battlefront by a large margin. Maybe some day, fans will come together and revive the online. That, or we can hope that we'll get a true sequel that isn't some stripped down mess that only has it's looks going for it. Until then, Battlefront II is still a viable option to scratch that itch for epic battles on land and in space.

content:
Posted: December 23, 2012
												Star Wars - Battlefront II is a third person shooter by LucasArts that puts you in the shoes of a common trooper or a droid while you reenact the greatest battle of the six Star Wars movies.You can play as the armies of the Republic, the CIS, the Empire and the Rebels, since the game covers both the Clone Wars and the Galactic Civil War eras from the Star Wars canon.Battlefront II spots a single player campaign revolving around a legion of elite clone soldiers, the 501st, as they serve the Republic during the Clone Wars during the last days of the democracy to later become one of the most feared army of the new Galactic Empire. The campaign takes place in several maps also available in multiplayer, but also tasks the player to complete several kinds of objective (like capturing a command post, destroying a target or defeat an enemy hero), so playing through the various missions feels like an unique experience and worth of a try.Battlefront II also introduces new maps where space battle take place: you can play as either a pilot or a marine from your faction, grab a ship (which can be either a heavy bombardier or a fast fighter) and try to severely damage the enemy fleet by either destroying its fighters or cripple its main ship either from the outside or the inside. While space battles always follow a strick formula with little room for alternative strategies, they are a welcome addition nevertheless.One of the major improvement from the original game in the sequel is about the hero units: while in Battlefront they weren't playable, the second game allows you to take direct control of them, albeit for a short time (which you can increase by killing enemies). You can play as both Sith and Jedi and scoundrels and bounty hunters from the two eras, each with his/her own weapons and powers.Another single player mode you can access in Battlefront II is the galactic conquest scenario: after choosing one of the four faction you are tasked to bring it to victory over its rival army and take absolute control of the galaxy. You have to move your army on a map of the galaxy and plan your attacks carefully. Winning confrontations grants you credits that can be used to purchase bonuses that can be activated for a single battle to enhance your armies (the bacta tanks perk will give your soldiers regenerating health, for instance).The multiplayer mode returns in Battlefront II in full force, offering several traditional game modes like capture the flag or control point captures or hunt on a pletora of new maps. It's also worth mentioning that the game has a very dedicated modding community always redy to develop new maps from different eras of the Star Wars canon (the Old Republic, for instance) or add new heroic or normal units per factions.Star Wars - Battlefront II is often labelled as one of the best games with a Star Wars license and I tend to agree, due to the very interesting and catchy gameplay and the excellent use of the series' canonic materials

content:
Posted: June 15, 2012
												Star Wars: Battlefront II is pretty darned fun. I absolutely love the great diversity in soldiers, the many different things that each class could do, the battle aspects, the animations (they look pretty damn awesome), how you can move your character around, like getting him to strafe that way, roll this way to avoid an enemy grenade, and zoom in with ease. Also to add onto the awesomeness known as Battlefront II is the Galactic Conquest, which kind of makes you feel like a general actually commanding, for example, the Empire's armies. If you read a bad report, the person who made that report has no idea what a game with some good work put into it looks like. Only problem is the graphics. They're O.K, but not great. I could go super in depth in everything good about this game like space battle which is the newest addition to the Battlefront series. I stand and applaud LucasArts and Pandemic for pulling off the single greatest space flight simulation game ever. The online play is fantastic and makes up for the mediocre enemy AI found in the single-player missions. I could sit here all day rambling on this game but i'm just going to leave it at this and say you should try out this game at least some time in your life if you are a Star Wars fan.

content:
Posted: July 31, 2014
												Possibly the best and the most enjoyable non-RPG Star Wars game made. Although mainly a FPS almost identical to the Battlefield series in the terms of the amount of reserves, but in this game there are also dogfight space battles and more, and also a more tactical game mode where you are to conquer the galaxy.The campaign is of a good length and covers the II-IV parts of the series, however you are able to play on any other planet that was mentioned in the series. The multiplayer is really fun, especially the Mos Eisley map where there is an option that every player is a special character. These include all the famous characters such as jedis, which are more powerful then the ordinary footsoldiers you get to play as in the singleplayer campaign. There are also bunch of other mods for these custom missions. The game is very fun to play with your friends, however the PC version does not include split-screen which is a shame, so you and your friends will have to play it online.The graphics are still good, although aged, unless you are a whiney Crysis kid who values the game by its visual aspects only. If that is the case then this game might not be for you. However if you are not and decide to get it, you will be suprised that the game still looks nice, but that isn't why you bought it then.Some people might also find the game hard to play, since it can get pretty difficult, especially in the later levels.The bad parts of the game is that there are some issues with newer versions of Windows, and that you might wait a couple of days before getting your CD key, since Disney shut down the magnificient LucasArts and we all know what Disney is about now : $$$The story is linear, and so are the objectives that are mainly to capture an objective or to defend a position while killing the enemy, but the combat is fun and the missions are interesting.Also the bad part is that there arent plenty of multiplayer servers (currently about 50) so you don't have quite a big choce, and most of them are filled with veterans who will dominate you over and over again, but when you are playing with friends you will probably host the game.I have played this game since it came out, and I have finished the singleplayer many times. If you have the amount of money it costs and you don't mind slightly outdated graphics, then immediately purchase this game and you won't regret it.

If that is the case then this game might not be for you. However if you are not and decide to get it, you will be suprised that the game still looks nice, but that isn't why you bought it then.Some people might also find the game hard to play, since it can get pretty difficult, especially in the later levels.The bad parts of the game is that there are some issues with newer versions of Windows, and that you might wait a couple of days before getting your CD key, since Disney shut down the magnificient LucasArts and we all know what Disney is about now : $$$The story is linear, and so are the objectives that are mainly to capture an objective or to defend a position while killing the enemy, but the combat is fun and the missions are interesting.Also the bad part is that there arent plenty of multiplayer servers (currently about 50) so you don't have quite a big choce, and most of them are filled with veterans who will dominate you over and over again, but when you are playing with friends you will probably host the game.I have played this game since it came out, and I have finished the singleplayer many times. If you have the amount of money it costs and you don't mind slightly outdated graphics, then immediately purchase this game and you won't regret it.

												Star Wars: Battlefront II is pretty darned fun. I absolutely love the great diversity in soldiers, the many different things that each class could do, the battle aspects, the animations (they look pretty damn awesome), how you can move your character around, like getting him to strafe that way, roll this way to avoid an enemy grenade, and zoom in with ease. Also to add onto the awesomeness known as Battlefront II is the Galactic Conquest, which kind of makes you feel like a general actually commanding, for example, the Empire's armies. If you read a bad report, the person who made that report has no idea what a game with some good work put into it looks like. Only problem is the graphics. They're O.K, but not great. I could go super in depth in everything good about this game like space battle which is the newest addition to the Battlefront series. I stand and applaud LucasArts and Pandemic for pulling off the single greatest space flight simulation game ever. The online play is fantastic and makes up for the mediocre enemy AI found in the single-player missions. I could sit here all day rambling on this game but i'm just going to leave it at this and say you should try out this game at least some time in your life if you are a Star Wars fan.

content:
Posted: December 1, 2016
												Just as fun as I rememberI sunk hundreds of hours into this game on the playstation back when I was a kid. I know for a fact that I'm not the only one who did. I've always loved Star Wars, and this certainly is a blast from the past. Definitely worth buying when it's on sale. Whether you played as much as I did on console, or your parents didn't love you and never gave you the game, this is definitely a staple of any gamers' library to look back on, back in the days before graphics were more important than innovation and, most important of all, FUN. Dozens (aka a F*CKTON) of widely-varied and memorable maps, the strategic conquest mode, SPACE BATTLES, satisfying sniper headshots, and of course the Star Wars music we all know and love (plus the awesome moment when you get to slice through mooks with lightsabers). It's been said in previous reviews of this game that there's way more content per dollar than Battlefieldfront, and I can definitely say that they're not exaggerating. At all. Controls take a bit to get used to on the mouse and keyboard and the graphics are super dated but that's just nitpicks for me to actively search for things to criticise the game on.And hey, it's better than the prequels. That's gotta count for something!II/10, would capture the enemy command post again

content:
Posted: November 8, 2014
												One of the most fun shooter games out there. I may only have a little bit of hours into the game, but on the PS2? Psh, only game I played!It's fairly balanced, has plenty of different and unique planets to fight on, and it has lasers! Sadly, no cats though...You can fight as the Galactic Empire, Rebel Alliance, Confederacy of Independant Systems (C.I.S) or the Galactic Republic. Each team is composed of 7 classes: Infantry, Rocket, Sniper, Engineer, and 2 specials. Each faction has about 3 or 4 heros available, with the likes of Yoda, Darth Vader, Anakin Skywalker, and more. Mods can also add to this list.The game has 16 different land battle maps, and 5 different layouts for space battles. The modes include Instant Action (Jump straight into a battle), Campaign (Fight through the later years of the Clone Wars, and partway through the Galactic Civil War in a set of objectives), and Galactic Conquest (Battle against the opposing faction in a full on war for control of the galaxy).If you get bored with the content of the game, you can find mods to add plenty of content to the game. They're easy to install, and can truly add the bang to your buck. If you want some starters, the Ultimate Conversion Pack is a great start. I also have a few guides favorited on my profile that have plenty of new maps for you to try.

Posted: December 4, 2015
												I first appear to have a few hours, but this is only my Steam version; I have many more hours on my other versions.I'm not going to log anymore hours on Steam, since DRM-free is the way to go with GOG, and because this will just serve as my GameRanger version. For the review:THE GAME'S AMAZING. Best. Star Wars. Game. Ever. Battlefront III is pathetic. Want those graphics in the much better game, this? There's mods.WARNING: MORE CAPITAL LETTERS TO GAIN YOUR ATTENTION: This game has trouble running on newer OSes, such as Windows 7.  Some users don't have audio, and I don't know how to fix that, the discussions should have you a fix.  Most of you want to be able to play your newly bought game, Battlefront II. To fix this problem, go to:Control Panel > Sound > Recording > Right click, select "Show disabled devices" > Enable "Stereo Mix"For some reason,  that fixes the game.  Now you can play it.  You can also play it in glorius 1080p60FPS. For some reason, the main menu is still 600x800 or something like that. Don't worry, it goes to 1080p when in game (just change the options).For more than compatiblilty, and base graphics, this game is better than Battlefront III in every way. Fine, online isn't great, but the game's 10+ years old. There's many Jedi in the game, when III has two. You can technically browse servers, but online is limited for a 10+-year-old game, where in III you can't. You're able to get in a ship, fly it towards the enemies, get out, and continue fighting. III just has a screenwipe to get in the ship (I'm unsure of how you get out).The game is intense fun. Shooting wookies in the face, blowing up clone/stormtroopers high into the sky has never been so fun. Force Pushing someone off the edge into the bottomless pit of doom (or just "off the map") to save yourself the effort of lightsabering them hasn't been so . . . funny, creative, or nice.  I HIGHLY recommend you get this game.  I  HIGHLY recommend this. Many others do too. Also, don't give me hate for saying Battlefront III is a bad game. It's a bad game. This is so much better.128v128 is awesome. 20v20 isn't as cool.

Posted: December 23, 2016
												They say no game is perfect but this game is perfection. I was nervous if this would run on my old PC, well it did run AND on highest graphics setting. There is two eras, the galatic civil war and the cloner wars, there are loads of heroes also, each map has a hero for each side that you can become. Classes are great because they are nicely balanced. You can use programs like Gameranger to play online too. If you don't want to download Gameranger you can play plenty of offline modes including space battles where you attack the enemy capitol ship! Galatic Conquest is flawless in my opinion and so is the campaign. If you love modern graphics that is the only downside. There is no DLC you can buy, it's all there at the start. I give it 9.5/10, only thing that stops it from being a 10 is that sometimes Galatic Conquest can be annoying.

content:
Posted: November 8, 2014
												One of the most fun shooter games out there. I may only have a little bit of hours into the game, but on the PS2? Psh, only game I played!It's fairly balanced, has plenty of different and unique planets to fight on, and it has lasers! Sadly, no cats though...You can fight as the Galactic Empire, Rebel Alliance, Confederacy of Independant Systems (C.I.S) or the Galactic Republic. Each team is composed of 7 classes: Infantry, Rocket, Sniper, Engineer, and 2 specials. Each faction has about 3 or 4 heros available, with the likes of Yoda, Darth Vader, Anakin Skywalker, and more. Mods can also add to this list.The game has 16 different land battle maps, and 5 different layouts for space battles. The modes include Instant Action (Jump straight into a battle), Campaign (Fight through the later years of the Clone Wars, and partway through the Galactic Civil War in a set of objectives), and Galactic Conquest (Battle against the opposing faction in a full on war for control of the galaxy).If you get bored with the content of the game, you can find mods to add plenty of content to the game. They're easy to install, and can truly add the bang to your buck. If you want some starters, the Ultimate Conversion Pack is a great start. I also have a few guides favorited on my profile that have plenty of new maps for you to try.

												I played Star Wars Battlefront II [2005] many years ago for a very long time – over 2400 hours on Xfire! This game is so much better than EA’s Battlefront, which is a terrible game by the way, and still playable in multiplayer with the program called GameRanger, which you can use for many old games. Battlefront II is with Empire at War and Knights of the old Republic one of the best Star Wars games and now I tell you why.GameRanger[www.gameranger.com]StoryWith 18 missions you have a solid campaign with an interesting story especially if you are a Star Wars fan. This is presented as a narration of a veteran of the 501st Legion, later known as Vader’s Fist. This man talks about the conversion of his legion and the feelings he had while he betrayed the republic. The missions always run basically the same scheme: You have to attack and conquer a command post and defend it. GameplayYou can compare Battlefront to Battlefield. You have different factions including the Galactic Empire, Galactic Republic, the Rebels and the Confederacy of Independent Systems with different classes like snipers, soldiers, engineers etc. with different tasks. For example an engineer can repair vehicles and use C4 to destroy enemy vehicles. In some matches you can play as a hero class for a certain time. Hero classes are strong characters as Obi-wan Kenobi, Yoda, Han Solo, Mace Windu, Darth Maul, Darth Vader, Boba Fett and many others known from the movies.Battlefront includes many game modes like the conquest mode where you have to conquer the command posts, Capture the Flag with one and two flags and hero- & space assault. In the hero assault it’s a simple death match with heroes and villians, which is very funny if you play this with friends. The space assault is also very funny, you must destroy the other battleship and/or the enemies like TIE-Fighters. Believe, me, with a Joystick this is just awesome.Graphic/SoundSince it was published in 2005, the graphics look very bad. Especially lights and shadows are very poor here, you can compare it to Counter Strike: Source. Battlefront II is one of the games where I ignore the bad graphic and enjoy the amazing gameplay, if you are able to do that too then the force is with you.The sound effects are nice, especially the sound of the blaster’s. I love that sound, it’s exactly the same from the movies, just great. Also the music is fantastic but how can it be otherwise? John Williams is a great composer. The music always fits the situation in the gameplay and the story, great work here. ParticularitiesIf you play this game you will feel the typical Star Wars atmosphere, which is very nice. There exist many sites with thousands of mods and maps out there to download which increase your experience while you play. As I said at the beginning you can still play online with or against your friends thanks to GameRanger. Perhaps it reminds you of old times like LAN-Parties and if not, you’ll gain a new experience. Go on and buy Star Wars Battlefront II and may the force be with you.

content:
Posted: February 3, 2016
												Compared to the new Battlefront EA Star wars battlefront 2 is a way better game than the one that came a decade laterThe Maps ] The maps in this game are all from episodes 1 - 6 which blows away the 4 maps that Battlefront EA gave us.There are a total of 34 maps 15 planets and part of those 34 maps are space battles which is pretty much what you'd think it is and is actually a pretty fun mode espically online Gameplay The gameplay consist of just shooting like any ordinary fps or using one of the vehicles. This is a class base selection game so you have to choose what class you would want to be From an engineer,sharpshooter,or marksman if you would. However let me assure you that there are atleast 4 Teams to choose between (depending on map that is) From the Prequels you've got The Republic and the Droids While in the sequals you've got the rebels and the empire. But overall my favorite part has to be the special characters Special characters (Heroes & Villains) From heroes you've gotHan soloChewbaccaYodaMace Winduaalaya securaPrincess leia Obi-WanLuke skywalkerKi-adi-Mundai (Hopefully this is the right name)VillainsBobba FettJango FettDarth VaderDarth MaulGeneral GrievousThe EmperorAnakin SkywalkerCount DookuThey've all got unique abilities and are really overpowered but on the bright side they've only got a limited amount of time to play as the characters unless your playing assault. Most jedi have the ability to either throw your light saber or force push them Han, Chewie, and Leia can only throw grenades or use their shields (Chewie Just uses the rage mode or whatever its called) While Darth Vader can Force Choke instead of force pushing but Count Dooku and The Emperor on the other hand cant lightsaber toss but can both Force choke and electricute other players While Bobba Fett can throw detpacks (C4's for short) or rockets while Jango fett can throw rockets and time bombs. The amount of characters into this game from 2005 are a total of 17 while Battlefront EA only has 6. The DLC  Wait why is this even here? there was never any dlc for battlefront 2! Well only the xbox version version has only one piece of downloadable content . You may skip this part if you want since this is only a reminder to people who keep saying battlefront 2 never had dlc. The xbox dlc was 4.99 and bringed 2 new heroes 4 new levels. The 4 levels were just battlefront 1 maps put into battlefront 2 while the 2 new heroes were (Hero) Kit Fisto and (Villain)Asajj Ventress. Online Play   Since May 31st 2014 the gamespy servers had shutdown which meant that the online in this game had also shut down but that doesnt mean theres a bypass. Meet Gameranger which is pretty much playable servers for battlefront 2 The link for gameranger is  www.gameranger.com (I totally Recommend) On a side note most servers can support up to 64 PlayersNote: From what i heard the ps2 servers are still up for the game so if you are really nostalgic why not make a private party for that version and invite some friends? Galactic Conquest   Galactic Conquest is the story mode for the game. You can choose from the same 4 teams I've said before. Each story has it's start and its endings. It is a really fun gamemode ranging from unlocking troops and powerups to visiting planets but was sadly taken of the Battlefront EA reboot which means there is no singleplayer in Battlefront EA (pitty) The Graphics  Of course the reboot wins in this department since the graphics are pretty bad now. Backthen it maybe was groundbreaking and by that i mean for the ps2 due to it being the weakest console in its generation. So this is the only time the EA reboot actually gets credit Conclusion   Battlefront 2 is the overall better game and is still going strong due to gameranger and the modding community who is making this game better and giving us new expieriences. So is it worth the $9.99? YES IT IS  Fun facts :DBattlefront 2 was released the same day as Star Wars Episode 3: Revenge of the sith was released on dvdBattlefront 2 was  released on Ps2. Xbox, Pc. and PSPBattlefront 2's single player was put in 1 month before the games releaseBattlefront 3 was 90% complete but was cancled due to bankruptcyThanks for reading and enjoy :D

content:
Posted: March 2, 2016
												This is the review you're looking for... *waves hand*I'll get right to it, the game is amazing! It says I've played 100 hours but I have at least 1,000 hours total with Steam and the regular DVD game. I've also put at least another 1000 hours in the PS2 version when I was a kid/teenager. Never in my life did I expect 1 game to be my main free time hobby for so long, and I can never see another game being such an addiction in the future. This game just has so much to offer along with endless replayablity. The amount of mods is staggering, you can get imports for all SWBF1 maps, you can get a 2GB conversion that puts Mass Effect into SWBF2, You can get another large conversion that puts Republic Commando in SWBF2. Those mods alone are still just 0.1% of the total addon content you can obtain. Multiplayer is also another awesome aspect - in my own personal way. The store page will say multiplayer is dead but there are 3 alternative fixes that you can EASILY install to get multoiplayer going again. The main are: GameRanger, GameMaster, and Tunngle. You can also do LAN play (PC to PC / Himachi). Anyway I personally don't like multiplayer, even though it is one of the best parts of the game. Most of the time you'll just be dealing with unstable servers with lack of adminning, and the gameplay online is just people spamming rocket troops. If you like demolition like death match then you'll love multiplayer. I personally hate multiplayer but it's only fun with friends in a private session. I've met some pretty epic people online despite hating multiplayer so that should say something! The other main aspect of the game is the large amounts of different types of singleplayer content. By default, you get Conquest, 1-Flag, 2-Flag, Space assault, Space 1-Flag, Hunt, and Hero assault on 1 map. You also get a quick-ish story campaign and galactic conquest. With mods support you can get so many more game mode types that I could not even know of them all. Some of my favorites are Free for all, Gun game mode and wave. I even got into modding myself, which is challenging but modding is only really hard if you're technically illiterate. I've never made any super big released, but some small game tweaks here there and a few joke mods. My main mod, which is sort of just a joke thing I made out of fun is a strip club on Coruscant that features hot tubs with naked dancing Twi'leks. For the obvious reason I never shared that mod publicy on modding/gaming sites. Anyway I will wrap this up, along with leaving a ton of useful information at the bottom. Rating: 10/10. Like, big fat ♥♥♥♥ing 10/10. This is well worth your ten dollars. This game just dupes the new EA Battlefront in every way. The only thing EA has over this is it's pretty colors and sounds.VARIOUS HELPFUL BITS OF INFORMATION:Multiplayer fixes:GameMaster - gameshare.coGameRanger - gameranger.comTunngle - tunngle.net (or is it .com? I forgot)Modding Sites for tutorials on modding and getting mods:swbfgamers.comgametoast.commoddb.comYoutube/media:You only need one link: https://www.youtube.com/user/BattlefrontJDgamer

content:
Posted: February 22, 2014
												Personnally I love the battlefront games and in my opinion there are no other star wars games other than these. The battle front games embody everything I ever dreamed about playing in a star wars game.While a bit dated the graphics are definitely legible. The game play is solid across the board and the controls are easy to get use to, whether you're on foot, on wheels, or in the air. The sounds are good and the music is fantastic. Multiplayer is fun and having the bots mixed in with players is awesome as it adds a nice mix of things to shoot. While BF2 does not feel as big as BF1, still have not figured out why, it may have been the blurring affect on the graphics of BF1, there is a mod available, thank god, that adds maps to the game and allows for MASSIVE battles to take place. While I can enjoy the multiplayer on the PC version I had more fun playing splitscreen co-op on the PS2 versions of both BF1 and 2 Especially galactic conquest. The combat is enjoyable but the missions do get a bit repetative after a while and holding strategic points is about complex as taking an objective gets. The galactic conquest map was interesting but from a gameplay stance it felt really unecessary to have an actual galactic representation of the galaxy. I found the the GC map from BF1 to be more player friendly. The space battles were a welcome, and needed, update for the series though I felt like they could have elaborated on the ship interiors a bit more and made it a really awesome thing to take 10 people over to an enemy ship in a transport and fight your way through a maze of self defense systems to the various ship system rooms. It was almost easier to go inside the ship to take it down than it was to try and take them down with bombers. Which in the end felt like a cheap gimick to get the player to actually go into the ship rather than actually providing something rewarding other than a victory.I recommend this game to everyone, give it a chance, you might like it.

content:
Posted: March 5, 2014
												This game is 9 years old, and it's just as good as I remember it. This, game for me, like many others, defined my childhood. I would spend hours on end playing my Playstation 2 with my friends, just playing Battlefront 2. This game is amazing stock, with a short but great campaign, and Galactic Conquest and Instant Action will occupy you for hours. The action and pace is fantastic, with large but not overwhelming battles, and tons of different firefight and lightsaber-duel scenarios. Multiplayer is pretty much the same, but really it all depends on the server, the players, and of course, your own internet connection.Another thing that I just HAD to cover was the mod side of things. There are some absolutely phenomenal mods for this game, ranging from skin changes, AI encounter changes, new maps, and even some ground to orbit maps, which seem a little crazy, but actually exist.Overall, this game is amazing. Even coming back six years later, the game is still a huge amount of fun, and is definitely worth the $10 price tag. I would rate Star Wars Battlefront 2 9/10 for giving Star Wars fans like me an amazing gaming experience!

content:
Posted: March 15, 2014
												One of the classic science fiction first person shooters based on the theme Starwars. It was the second part of a very amusing game of battlefront. The space missions have improved. Also the first person combat is better then the previous part. The music is well straight from the movies so it is perfect. The graphics start to look a little outdated but they still have survived the tooth of time. The gameplay is very good. The multiplayer features actually enabled me in the past to communicate with people all over the globe and started to join clan and community memberships. I recall good old clans days when I was a member of Anubis, TMR, IOGC. The first attempts to work as a team and try the "squad based tactics". Back than we actually ruled the server with superior teamwork. Each and everyone with their own "specialties" in the game. I recall a good online friend Dr. Legg who sadly passed away already a long time ago. He was always in for a good laugh and still loyal to his team and teammates. I have some very good memories of this game. It was very good for my communication skills in the languages English and German. It didn't matter where you came from. We ended up with people form all kinds of places of the globe The United Kingdom, Germany, Norway, Netherlands, Canada, Israel. We just had one rule: We are here for fun so don't speak about politics. And when people obliged to that rule it was always fun. Because people were doing what they enjoyed the most e.g. gaming and working together the game made a base for communication. You got to know each other a little bit and it thus enable communication between people who never were able or thought they were able to communicate to eachother. Even after all these years this game (theme) hasn't lost his magic at all. If you haven't played this game you should. You won't regret it at all.

content:
Posted: June 19, 2015
												Star Wars Battlefront II is a fantastic game despite its rather old age. A greatly voice acted and narrated campaign is just the icing on this Star Wars themed cake which is accompanied by an assortment different singleplayer game modes including Galactic Conquest, which is reminiscent of Star Wars Empire at War, another great game. The AI is rather dumb, but that's to be expected with a game that is a decade old; the campaign still manages to challenge you at times, especially if you don't know what to expect. Unfortunately, the multiplayer servers hosted by Gamespy have been shut down recently, but third party programs such as Game Ranger allows you to experience the still living-breathing online scene, which is made even better if you have a group of friends to screw around with.The wide array of vehicles, special units, and heroes makes Battlefront a fun game to play to this day, and I would highly recommend it to anyone looking for a fun Star Wars shooter.

content:
Posted: November 4, 2013
												While I can't really see this as much of a creative game now, as its not much more of a Battlefield rip-off over a licensed title, and the Star Wars mod for BF2142 being a more authentic SW game in every aspect, I can certainly say I good chunk of my 4th grade was eaten up by this game, as it was the only depitcion of the imaginative battle's one could think up with this series' vast merchandise. Pandemic was never one for programming good multiplayer, and I never got hooked on the mutliplayer, so I know I have some bias against on of the better aspects of this game. The campaign was hard and fun, galactic conquest was galaxies (punny) beter than that mode in the first. Maps were weaker than the first game, and I quite miss the Rhen Var maps, its stil amazing how Pandemic made up to 4 different game modes per map with 3 teams. Jedi were something to be feared and while not balanced in MP created an entirely new objective. Space battles were fun although got very boring after repeated tries in Galactic conquest or MP rounds with someone leagues better than the rest of the team ending the game in minutes.7/10

												I recommend this for gamers who like: FPS or Star Wars.Personal opinion: Really good game. I remember playing it on the PS2, but got annoyed because my PS2 game was very laggy in the menu. However when I got in-game the game worked great it was just the menu was so laggy it took forever just to select all the maps I wanted.Issues: The game is old and you may dislike how the game functions. Two technical issues I encountered include:1. I would get my game set up for me to play. And as soon as it loads my game it crashes.2. The mouse doesn't work in-game, it works in the menu, but not in-game. People have mentioned the use of controllers. However I got this to see how it would be like to play with a keyboard and mouse.Story: I haven't played through the campaign yet, the reason I didn't on the PS2 was because of how laggy my game was and because some maps didn't work.Technical Issue 1(Fixed): For those of you experiencing immediate game crashes just as you're about to enter game, go to your sound recording settings and turn on your "Stereo Mix" setting. This should fix your problem. If you don't have Windows 8, ask me and I'll try to find a solution to your problem, if I can.Technical Issue 2(Fixed): I forgot to make sure my mouse X and Y-axis controls were set.Note: I would recommend this game for those who have played it before, just to bring back memories.If you have any questions, ask me and I'll answer them as best as I can.

												I recomend this game strictly for it actually being a game. It has a campaign that can be easily forgotten if you're not paying attention sure but if you do (which I recomend you should) you'll hear some rather good voice acting for its age and a story that isn't half♥♥♥♥♥♥♥ Ok so the campagin is alright and it sounds pretty, that dosen't mean it's a good game by those things alone. Its gameplay needs be solid and combat smooth right? Well this game does have it's beautiful moments and moments where it just seems a bit baren at times, it happens especialy on some maps but that's about all bad I can say about it. (Other than the obvious fact that the multiplayer is un-able to be played unless you LAN or do some server outsourcing but that I'd rather not beat that dead horse.) There are moments where you're leading a charge with your droid brothers in metal to push back the enemy advance on your position, times where you're just a small and almost pointless looking spec in a huge fight on an ice-planet while giant robot camels slowly close in on your base while dozens upon dozens of both yours and theirs fall per minute with no end. And then there are times where you're just floating through space trying to find something to shoot at that isn't being masacered by your AI team-mates.Ok so the game is good now yes? Well it would seem like it but there is something you do need to hear, some people can't play the game. I don't mean this in the sence that they are inept at the gameplay or brain-dead, I mean they physically can't get the game to run on their system. This fact alone means that if you buy this game make sure it can work for you. I don't know how to fix this problem so don't ask me, I'm just recomending a damn game here.

content:
Posted: January 2, 2016
												Space battlesCampaign ModeGalactic Conquest64-player battles20 maps (without mods)15 Heroes/VillainsNo DLCFor a game that is released in 2005, SW Battefront II holds up surprisingly well. Aiming is spot on, and while light saber battle and vehicle control are kinda clunky, you will get used to it quickly. The score is also true to its roots providing many familiar music from the original source material.The graphics, while not good stil give you the immersion of vastness that is always present on Star Wars. The map is also big and the transtition between foot battle and vehicle is almost seamless. The core mechanics are also well done and the variety of game modes gives you plenty of options to play.Between galactic conquest, campaign and a pleathora of maps you can take on in "Instant Action", the vanilla game has already packed with so much content you can play it for hours without running out of content. But this game also have mods support (quite an active one for game this old). With the addition of mos, you can play this game for a really long time, there's also multiplayer (now via gameranger). Do yourself a favor and start explorng modDB.com to see mods other people make.10/10 Better than Dice's Battlefront 2015

												I recomend this game strictly for it actually being a game. It has a campaign that can be easily forgotten if you're not paying attention sure but if you do (which I recomend you should) you'll hear some rather good voice acting for its age and a story that isn't half♥♥♥♥♥♥♥ Ok so the campagin is alright and it sounds pretty, that dosen't mean it's a good game by those things alone. Its gameplay needs be solid and combat smooth right? Well this game does have it's beautiful moments and moments where it just seems a bit baren at times, it happens especialy on some maps but that's about all bad I can say about it. (Other than the obvious fact that the multiplayer is un-able to be played unless you LAN or do some server outsourcing but that I'd rather not beat that dead horse.) There are moments where you're leading a charge with your droid brothers in metal to push back the enemy advance on your position, times where you're just a small and almost pointless looking spec in a huge fight on an ice-planet while giant robot camels slowly close in on your base while dozens upon dozens of both yours and theirs fall per minute with no end. Well it would seem like it but there is something you do need to hear, some people can't play the game. I don't mean this in the sence that they are inept at the gameplay or brain-dead, I mean they physically can't get the game to run on their system. This fact alone means that if you buy this game make sure it can work for you. I don't know how to fix this problem so don't ask me, I'm just recomending a damn game here.

												If you are trying to deside between this game and the new Battle Front, get this one!  Sure the graphics are'nt as good but at least this one has a story!  The Galactic Conquest mode is fun though it does seem to repeat it self.  Basically it goes like this: 1: Choose your side (CIS, Clone Army, Galactic Empire, Rebel Alliance)2: Move around the galaxy either attacking enemy planets, defending your own, or destroying enemy ships in space battles3: The team with the most planets win.Ground battles are unit based.  in other words, you must stay alive!  if you lose all of your troops you loose.  Space battles are point based.  each fighter you destroy is worth 1 point.  frigates are worth more than that (I forget exactly how much) , and even more for parts of the main enemy ship.  you cant attack the main ship directly ( unless you are attacking the sheild in which case i sugest you fly inside the ship and destory the sheild generator) you have to attack the different parts.  such as the bridge, life support, comms, engines, and one other thing.I would review the multiplayer but i have not been able to use it.all in all i give this game an 8/10

												I used to play this on my original Xbox all the time and it was amazing. This game has everything you want in a Star Wars shooter game. Different classes for different tasks. Space Battles. Playing as characters from the movies. Large scale battles where you feel expendable. This games flaws are minor. The only slightly game-effecting issue is the AI. If they pilot a ship with you in it they crash the ship. This next point spoiler-ish about campaign, but a genuine problem.  During the mission "Knightfall" you have to defend the bookcases in the library of Coruscant. When jedi knights attack bookcases, which have very little health, the AI on your team does not attack them and sits there sometimes. Which makes this mission INCREDIBLY difficult at times.  Anyways, this game is still fun, shame that Gamespy shut down, but you can still use other softwaresfor multiplayer.

content:
Posted: June 19, 2015
												Star Wars Battlefront II is a fantastic game despite its rather old age. A greatly voice acted and narrated campaign is just the icing on this Star Wars themed cake which is accompanied by an assortment different singleplayer game modes including Galactic Conquest, which is reminiscent of Star Wars Empire at War, another great game. The AI is rather dumb, but that's to be expected with a game that is a decade old; the campaign still manages to challenge you at times, especially if you don't know what to expect. Unfortunately, the multiplayer servers hosted by Gamespy have been shut down recently, but third party programs such as Game Ranger allows you to experience the still living-breathing online scene, which is made even better if you have a group of friends to screw around with.The wide array of vehicles, special units, and heroes makes Battlefront a fun game to play to this day, and I would highly recommend it to anyone looking for a fun Star Wars shooter.
